Tool

NameObject Based Image Segmentation
IDobia
AuthorO.Conrad (c) 2014
File/usr/share/saga/toolchains/obia.xml

Description

This Object Based Image Segmentation tool chain combines a number of tools for an easy derivation of geo-objects as polygons and is typically applied to satellite imagery. Segmentation is done using a 'Seeded Region Growing Algorithm'. Optionally the resulting polygons can be grouped by an unsupervised classification (k-means cluster analysis), which is performed on the basis of zonal feature grid statistics for each polygon.
References:
  • Adams, R. & Bischof, L. (1994): Seeded Region Growing. IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence, Vol.16, No.6, p.641-647.
  • Bechtel, B., Ringeler, A. & Boehner, J. (2008): Segmentation for Object Extraction of Trees using MATLAB and SAGA. In: Boehner, J., Blaschke, T., Montanarella, L. [Eds.]: SAGA - Seconds Out. Hamburger Beitraege zur Physischen Geographie und Landschaftsoekologie, 19:59-70. online
